name: Kepler-325
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-325 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-325 is a star with 0.9470000000000001 times the mass of the Sun, and 1 times its radius. It is located 2749.89 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-325 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-325 b

Kepler-325 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 4.54 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-325.

The mass of Kepler-325 b is 12.53 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-325 b is 2.91 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-325 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

Kepler-325 c

Kepler-325 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.10 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 12.76 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-325.

The mass of Kepler-325 c is 9.05 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-325 c is 2.54 that of Earth. At 9.05 Earth masses, Kepler-325 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-325 d

Kepler-325 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.22 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 38.72 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-325.

The mass of Kepler-325 d is 11.30 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-325 d is 2.79 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-325 d is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-325, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
